alert.note: Alert for City and Borough of Juneau (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 08 at 3:50AM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKDT TODAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Mendenhall Lake and River, Montana Creek and Jordan Creek near Areas Around Montana Creek, Skaters Cabin Road, Mendenhall Campground, View Drive And Jordan Creek Mall. * WHEN...Until noon AKDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 341 AM AKDT, river gauge reports indicate rises in water levels from heavy rain in areas around Montana Creek, Skaters Cabin Road, Mendenhall campground, View Drive and Jordan Creek Mall. Minor flooding is ongoing, especially near Mendenhall Lake and River, Montana Creek and Jordan Creek. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible. - For Auke Lake near Auke Bay: At 3:00am the stage was 32.59 feet. Flood Stage is 33.0 feet. Impacts: At 33.0 feet: Water from the lake will inundate yards of homes along Auke Lake. - For Jordan Creek near Juneau: At 3:00am the stage was 9.94 feet. Flood Stage is 9.7 feet. Forecast: A crest is expected Sunday morning. Impacts: At 9.7 feet: Water will inundate the Jordan Square`s front and back parking lots, around Jordan Creek office condominiums with up to one foot of water. Some residential driveways will be flooded and cut off. - For Montana Creek at Back Loop Bridge: At 3:00am the stage was 14.81 feet. Flood Stage is 14.5 feet. Forecast: A crest is expected Sunday morning. Impacts: At 14.5 feet: Water begins flowing over the low water crossing on Montana Creek Road. Bankfull conditions at the gauge with water starting to inundate adjacent undeveloped fields along Mendenhall Loop Road. - For Mendenhall Lake : At 2:15am the stage was 8.31 feet. Flood Stage is 9.0 feet. Forecast: A crest is expected Sunday morning. Impacts: At 6.7 feet: Nugget Falls trail begins to flood near the "causeway" at the end of the trail. At 7.7 feet: Nugget Falls trail begins to flood near the beginning of the trail. Along the Mendenhall River some sections will experience bank erosion resulting in dangerous tree fall. These conditions could make floating the river more hazardous with the higher water levels. - Storm drains should be kept clear of debris as much as possible.
info.instruction: Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
